page.title: 18Eversley Parish
page.content: Eversley has had a place of worship for thousands of years. There is one church in the area and it is Church of England.{The Rev. Michael Perry}is the present rector. This year it is the 250th anniversary of the bell-tower being built. Two bells are being restored, two new bells installed and there is space for two more bells in years to come. More land has been purchased to extend the graveyard. There are 172 people on the electoral roll, but 320 households in the village have connections with the church through youth organisations, Sunday Schools and Bible-study groups. The civil parish covers Eversley whereas the ecclesiastical parish covers Eversley and Bramshill. The most well-attended service is the Family Service on the first Sunday in the month with 150 people.
